title: Facebook ads push new Ov3r_Stealer password-stealing malware
description: A new password-stealing malware named Ov3r_Stealer is spreading through fake job advertisements on Facebook, aiming to steal account credentials and cryptocurrency. [...]

title: Denmark orders schools to stop sending student data to Google
description: The Danish data protection authority (Datatilsynet) has issued an injunction regarding student data being funneled to Google through the use of Chromebooks and Google Workspace services in the country's schools. [...]

title: Chinese hackers hid in US infrastructure network for 5 years
description: The Chinese Volt Typhoon cyber-espionage group infiltrated a critical infrastructure network in the United States and remained undetected for at least five years before being discovered, according to a joint advisory from CISA, the NSA, the FBI, and partner Five Eyes agencies. [...]

title: Google tests blocking side-loaded Android apps with risky permissions
description: Google has launched a new pilot program to fight financial fraud by blocking the sideloading of Android APK files that request access to risky permissions. [...]

title: Critical Cisco bug exposes Expressway gateways to CSRF attacks
description: Cisco has patched several vulnerabilities affecting its Expressway Series collaboration gateways, two of them rated as critical severity and exposing vulnerable devices to cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks. [...]

title: No, 3 million electric toothbrushes were not used in a DDoS attack
description: A widely reported story that 3 million electric toothbrushes were hacked with malware to conduct distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks is likely a hypothetical scenario instead of an actual attack. [...]

title: The unlikely 3 million electric toothbrush DDoS attack
description: A widely reported story that 3 million electric toothbrushes were hacked with malware to conduct distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks is likely a hypothetical scenario instead of an actual attack. [...]

title: Critical flaw in Shim bootloader impacts major Linux distros
description: A critical vulnerability in the Shim Linux bootloader enables attackers to execute code and take control of a target system before the kernel is loaded, bypassing existing security mechanisms. [...]

title: How to Apply Zero Trust to your Active Directory
description: With cyberattacks happening everyday, how can we apply zero trust principles towards keeping our Active Directory secure? Learn more from Specops Software on how to apply zero trust principles. [...]

title: Chinese hackers fail to rebuild botnet after FBI takedown
description: Chinese Volt Typhoon state hackers failed to revive a botnet recently taken down by the FBI, which was previously used in attacks targeting critical infrastructure across the United States. [...]

title: Ransomware payments reached record $1.1 billion in 2023
description: Ransomware payments in 2023 soared above $1.1 billion for the first time, shattering previous records and reversing the decline seen in 2022, marking the year as an exceptionally profitable period for ransomware gangs. [...]

title: Fortinet snafu: Critical FortiSIEM CVEs are duplicates, issued in error
description: It turns out that critical Fortinet FortiSIEM vulnerabilities tracked as CVE-2024-23108 and CVE-2024-23109 are not new and have been published this year in error. [...]
